* Make : FMV-Biblo
* Model: MG75TN
* Website: http://www.fmworld.net/product/hard/pcpm0608/biblo_loox/mg/lineup/index.html#cus01 (in Japanese)
** Specs: http://www.fmworld.net/product/hard/pcpm0608/biblo_loox/mg/method/index.html#cus (in Japanese)

=== Current Issues ===

* returning from suspend the backlight stays off. Adding the following script '''/etc/acpi/resume.d/99-undim.sh''' solves this (inspired by http://www.xmission.com/~bmidgley/p1510/)
<pre>
echo 88 > /proc/acpi/video/GFX0/LCD/brightness
</pre>

* Many of the function keys/multi media keys don't work <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+bug/77687|77687]]</nowiki>

=== Hardware details ===

* Fujitsu FMV Biblo MG75TN
* Intel Core Duo T2400 @ 1.83GHz
* 4GB Memory (3366720k visible from BIOS)
* 120GB HDD Ultra ATA/100: FUJITSU MHV2120A (120034 MB)
* ATAPI 24X DVD-ROM DVD-R-RAM CD-R/RW drive, 2048kB Cache, UDMA(33)
* 14" XGA TFT Screen (1400x1050)
* Intel Corporation Mobile 945GM/GMS/940GML Express Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 03)
* Intel Corporation 82801G (ICH7 Family) High Definition Audio Controller (rev 02)
* Modem:
* LAN: Marvell Technology Group Ltd. 88E8055 PCI-E Gigabit Ethernet Controller (rev 12)
* WLAN: ipw3945 (Intel Corporation PRO/Wireless 3945ABG Network Connection (rev 02)
* Bluetooth: 
* USB (3 ports):
* Firewire:
* SD Card reader
* Windows XP Professional
* Japanese Keyboard
* output of sudo dmidecode -s system-manufacturer; sudo dmidecode -s system-product-name; sudo dmidecode -s system-version
<pre>
FUJITSU
FMVMG75TN8

</pre>
==== Notes ====

* Has a killswitch at the front to toggle WLAN and Bluetooth.

* I wish it had a little white LED, and a third mouse button like a ThinkPad
